section1.title: What is this app?
section1.body: This application is designed as a showcase of reusable examples, utilities and components built using React, TypeScript and Tailwind CSS. Its purpose is to provide a solid base for modern projects, demonstrating design patterns, API integration, internationalization and advanced components.

section2.title: Technologies used
section2.body: It includes examples of API integration, a global alert system, reusable components such as paged tables, autocomplete, theme management, i18n, dynamic navigation and more.

games.title: Glypy & Xalatax
games.body:
More than 15 years ago I developed two small videogames using C# and Microsoft XNA, a framework that enabled many developers to create 2D and 3D experiences for Windows and Windows Phone. These projects were my first real experiments in game design, graphics programming, and performance optimization on mobile devices.

The first game, **Glypy**, is a classic platformer where the player progresses by overcoming obstacles, jumps, and enemies, keeping a simple but fun style. The second one, **Xalatax**, is an arcade-style shoot ’em up packed with fast action, continuous firing, and a strong retro inspiration. Both projects represent a very special stage of experimentation and learning that helped shape my path as a developer.
